definition: dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to rub/to grind/to polish/to sharpen/to wear down/to die out/to waste time/to pester/to insist

sentences.english: Millstones had been cut and laboriously sledged down the rough mountainsides .
sentences.chinese: 石磨被琢好，然后费力用雪橇运下那崎岖不平的山坡。

sentences.english: The most ancient millstone was unearthed just nearby.
sentences.chinese: 附近曾经出土过最古老的石磨盘。

sentences.english: I can see into a millstone, as the saying be.
sentences.chinese: 我正如俗语所说的一般能够洞察石磨。

sentences.english: Stone ground wheat flour and cracked wheat just describe how grain is processed.
sentences.chinese: 石磨麦面粉和碾碎麦只是描述麦粒是被如何加工的。

sentences.english: The millstone installed on the ground. People should stoop to push it slowly.
sentences.chinese: 磨盘安在地上，人推石磨时得弓腰缓行。

sentences.english: The miller ground the ear of wheat into fine white flour.
sentences.chinese: 石磨把小麦磨成了白色的细面粉。

sentences.english: I can see into a millstone, as the saying is.
sentences.chinese: 俗语所说的一般能够洞察石磨。

sentences.english: I can see into a millstone as the saying is.
sentences.chinese: 我正如俗语所说的一般能够洞察石磨。

sentences.english: Millstones had been cut and laboriously sledged down the rough mountainsides.
sentences.chinese: 石磨被琢好，然后费力用雪橇运下那崎岖不平的山坡。
